section.audio_text: When manually trimming the airplane, good crew coordination is essential. If starting from an in-trim condition and manual trim becomes necessary, the pilot flying can make the necessary trim adjustments or delegate the task to the pilot monitoring.

On the following slides, several manual trim techniques will be discussed. Depending on the out of trim condition and the force required to move the stabilizer trim wheel, the flight crew should coordinate which technique would provide the most effective solution.
